issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: FairScheduler does not allow queue names with leading or tailing spaces or empty sub-queue names anymore.

fields.summary: Fair Scheduler should not accept apps with space keys as queue name

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Leading space, trailing space and empty sub queue name may cause MetricsException(Metrics source XXX already exists! ) when add application to FairScheduler.
The reason is because QueueMetrics parse the queue name different from the QueueManager.
QueueMetrics use Q_SPLITTER to parse queue name, it will remove Leading space and trailing space in the sub queue name, It will also remove empty sub queue name.
{code}
  static final Splitter Q_SPLITTER =
      Splitter.on('.').omitEmptyStrings().trimResults(); 
{code}
But QueueManager won't remove Leading space, trailing space and empty sub queue name.
This will cause out of sync between FSQueue and FSQueueMetrics.
QueueManager will think two queue names are different so it will try to create a new queue.
But FSQueueMetrics will treat these two queue names as same queue which will create "Metrics source XXX already exists!" MetricsException.

Instead of handling it in FairScheduler, can we handle this in QueueManager? Essentially, verify the provided queue name is valid before creating it, and throw a very descriptive exception when it is not valid. I think the queue splitting logic also belongs in QueueManager.

Hi [~kasha], thanks for the review, your suggestion sounds reasonable to me. I uploaded a new patch YARN-3241.001.patch  which addressed your comment.
Also I find we need check the queue name in FairScheduler Config File to avoid similar issue, So I add code to check the queue name in Config File and add a test case for it. Please review it.

Thanks for the update, Zhihai. A couple of minor comments:
# Let us rename QueueNameException to InvalideQueueNameException
# QueueManager#checkQueueNodeName: If we want this method to boolean, I propose we call it isQueueNameValid. Otherwise, we should probably make it void and throw the exception from within this method and not have a separate check at the caller site.
Hi [~kasha], many thanks for the review. These are very good suggestions. I uploaded a new patch YARN-3241.002.patch, which addressed all your comments. Please review it.
